page.title: 06HEM HEATH COLLIERY, BLURTON
page.content: To go down the pit men are provided with underwear, trousers, a jacket, overalls, a helmet and a cap lamp. They wear self-rescuers on their belts. The men's overalls are washed at work if they require this facility. You do not have to be a certain height to go down the pit, but you have to be 7 stone because it is such heavy work. There is a Hem Heath Social club which organises many activities like football, bowls, cricket, Christmas parties for miner's children and other functions. The club is also used by people in the local area of Blurton who are not miners because many of the miners live up to 16 miles away. A lot of men moved to Hem Heath when the Victoria colliery closed at Biddulph. A lot of miners had their own transport, but the pit puts buses on to bring men to work.
